summary: Basically, during a background task: - if the user has wifi enabled and mobile data turned on the phone will opt for mobile data - if the user has wifi enabled and wifi enabled during sleep (and mobile data) the phone *should* opt for wifi - if the user has wifi enabled, wifi enabled during sleep and mobile data off, the check for network will succeed (uses wifi) - if the user has wifi enabled, mobile data off, the check for network will fail (timeout) - if the user has wifi disabled, mobile data on, the check for network will succeed (uses mobile data) At the end of the day the best you can do is inform your users.
keywords: wifi, phone, network, mobile, enabled, data
title: Detect wifi on Windows Phone
